meanings.definition: One who appropriates something for a particular purpose.
meanings.sent1: The appropriator of the tools used them to fix the broken chair.
meanings.sent2: The school appropriator allocated funds for new textbooks.
meanings.sent3: The clever appropriator turned old tires into colorful planters.
meanings.sent4: She was an appropriator of time, always finding ways to make the most of each day.
meanings.sent5: The young appropriator's creativity knew no bounds when it came to repurposing items.

meanings.definition: A person who takes possession of something, often without permission.
meanings.sent1: The sneaky appropriator took the cookies from the jar when no one was looking.
meanings.sent2: The art gallery had to deal with an appropriator who tried to steal a valuable painting.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous appropriator thought it was funny to hide his friend's backpack.
meanings.sent4: The shadowy figure in the night seemed like an appropriator of secrets.
meanings.sent5: The bold appropriator snatched the opportunity before anyone else could.
